pages.text:
Support Us
Support Us
playersbythesea
2024-04-15T16:41:30-04:00
Your Support Keeps Excellent Theatre at Jacksonville Beach
The tickets you purchase only cover part of the cost to bring you quality community theatre. We are a volunteer-driven organization, from our Board of Directors all the way to our stage crews. Thanks to the support, generosity and passion of community members like yourself, we are able to bring live and innovative theatre to Jacksonville Beach year after year.  The additional gifts we receive throughout the year cover our costs to turn on the lights and light up the show!
Make a Donation
Make a secure, tax-deductible donation to Players by the Sea! Every donation, from $1 to $1,000 helps us to bring incredible theatre to Jacksonville.
DONATE NOW
Sponsor a Show
Your sponsorship goes way past providing monetary support. Having your name or company name above the title of the production demonstrates your passion and great care for the part that arts and culture play in a thriving economy.
BECOME A SPONSOR
Playbill Advertisement
For each production, a comprehensive playbill is printed with all kinds of information about the performance and it includes advertisements from local businesses, sharing and showing support for Players by the Sea.
ADVERTISE

Staff & Board
Staff & Board
playersbythesea
2025-08-19T17:47:41-04:00
Bradley
Akers
Managing Director
LEARN MORE
×
Bradley Akers
Managing Director
Bradley Akers is a multi-disciplinary theatre artist and arts administrator based in Northeast Florida, proudly serving as the Managing Director of Players by the Sea. His appointment marks a meaningful homecoming—Akers began his professional career at PBTS in 2013 and has remained a passionate advocate for community-driven theatre ever since.
Throughout his tenure with PBTS, Akers has championed artists both on and off the stage, fostering creative growth through innovative programming and engagement initiatives. One of his proudest accomplishments is developing the New Voices program, a yearlong new play development initiative that has brought 8 original works by Northeast Florida writers to life on stage.
Now at the helm of Players by the Sea, Akers is focused on setting the stage for long-term growth. His leadership is rooted in a commitment to strategic activation, operational efficiency, and expanded community connection—all with the goal of making theatre accessible to everyone.
From 2020 to 2023, Akers served as Managing Artistic Director of The 5 & Dime Theatre Co., where he revitalized the company following a pandemic-related shutdown. Under his leadership, the theatre returned to production, established a residency at The Florida Ballet, doubled its budget, and created accessible pathways for artists and audiences alike.
As a director, Akers has helmed award-winning productions across Northeast Florida, including
Funny Girl, Jekyll & Hyde, Urinetown, Assassins, Doubt, Chicago, Parade, The Thanksgiving Play, The Harvest, Fun Home, The Robber Bridegroom, Heathers the Musical, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time, The Walls, ‘night, Mother, Into the Woods, The Last 5 Years, Almost, Maine, AIDA, Godspell
, and
Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead
. In addition to directing, he works as a scenic, lighting, and sound designer.
Akers’ passion for theatre education runs deep. From 2021 to 2023, he taught Directing and Play Analysis at Douglas Anderson School of the Arts, his alma mater. There, he encouraged students to unlock their potential through ensemble-based and analytical approaches to theatre-making.
Akers is a born storyteller, coffee-addict, sweater-enthusiast, husband, dog dad, and a lover of kindness.
Brandon
Hines
Box Office Coordinator
LEARN MORE
×
Brandon Hines
Box Office Coordinator
Brandon Hines is a Jacksonville, Florida native and a graduate of Douglas Anderson School of the Arts who has proudly been part of the Jacksonville theatre community since 2015.
His experience at Players by the Sea started onstage in
AIDA
(2015.) He appeared in our productions of
La Cage aux Folles, Memphis, American Idiot
, and
Little Shop of Horrors
. Aside from performing, Brandon worked as an Education Instructor and as a Costume Designer & Supervisor for productions from 2016-2018.
Throughout Jacksonville, Brandon has appeared onstage in
Company
and
Assassins
(The 5 & Dime),
The Robber Bridegroom
and
Violet
(ABET), and
The Prom
(Greenlight Theatre Company.) Brandon is also an esteemed drag performer around town.
Brandon comes to Players by the Sea after working at MassageEnvy, Trulieve, Hamburger Mary’s, and SET Studios

About Us
About Us
playersbythesea
2024-03-19T14:06:13-04:00
Enriching the community through excellence in theatre
We are Players by the Sea
Players by the Sea presents productions that are engaging, thought-provoking, emotionally stimulating and entertaining through the extraordinary support and dedication from community volunteers – actors, directors, designers, backstage crews, carpenters, visual artists, etc. Players by the Sea is an artistic home for anyone who wants to engage with the community through interactive and incredible storytelling.
Players by the Sea enriches the community through excellence in theatre.
Players by the Sea is an
artist-driven community theatre
committed to enriching audiences and volunteers by providing:
Creative Opportunities
Artistic Risk-Taking
Collaborative, Respectful Atmosphere
Educational Opportunities for All
Multi-cultural Perspectives
Thoughtful Conversations About Human Connection
Productions
Players by the Sea features two performance spaces – the 150-seat John McManus Mainstage Theatre and the intimate 80-seat Grace Darling Studio Theatre. We tell a wide variety of stories, ranging from large Broadway musicals to edgy contemporary plays to re-invigorated classics. Our productions have garnered local awards, including Folio Weekly’s Best Production in Jacksonville (Rent, 2014) and BroadwayWorld Jacksonville’s Best Musical (American Idiot, 2017) and Best Play (Fences, 2017).
Our Venue
Conveniently located in Jacksonville Beach, our venue is perfect distance to dining establishments, shopping, and of course, the beautiful beach.
​
In addition to our two performance spaces, our venue includes:
Classroom + Rehearsal Space equipped with mirrors and special dance flooring
Workshop
Costume Shop + Storage
Art Gallery
Dressing Rooms
Some of these spaces are available for rent!
INQUIRE ABOUT RENTALS
